Share.d:
v2.0.0
This project will turn on email notifications for a single account during select hours and on days when there is no "Out of office" event on your calendar.
It has two profiles: one that also checks a calendar for events indicating your employer is closed for holidays, and one that does not.
This also has an installer that helps you select the times and the Google calendars to check for these events. If you don't use Google calendars, then you'll need to edit the profile contexts directly or directly edit the variables' values.
See https://github.com/c-d-smith/android-automation/projects/email-control for more information.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
The next dialogs will help you choose the hours during which your phone will notify you of new email and the calendars to use to determine when you are out of the office. This setup routine assumes you're using Google calendars.
Tap "Full Setup" to set the notification hours and Google calendars.
### If you don't use Google calendars ###
You will be able to set the hours during which you'll be notified. However, you'll need to edit the profile conditions to select the correct calendars.
Tap "Partial Setup" to set only the notification hours. After this installer completes, tap "PROFILES", then tap the profile to expand it.
Tap each calendar condition to edit it. Find the variable (either WorkCalendar or HolidayCalendar) and erase it, including the % sign.
Finally, tap the magnifying glass icon on the right side (just above the input field you just cleared). This will display a list of calendars that your phone syncs. Select the appropriate calendar from the list, then tap the back arrow in the upper left corner.
### NOTE ### If you have another project that uses the variables "HolidayCalendar" and/or "WorkControl", choose "Partial Setup" because this project will use those variables' values.

Action.label: Get the time email notifications should end.
Action.Str: Email Control: Setup: Input: End Time

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Setup is now complete.
You can run this installer again in the future by tapping the VARS tab, changing the value of SetupEmailControl (to anything other than false), then turning the setup profile on.

Action.label: Get the user's work Google calendar.
Action.Str: Email Control: Setup: Input: Work Calendar

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%input Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Select the time of day you want to start receiving notifications for new emails.
### NOTE ### The time must be in 24 hour format.
If you want a time between 1:00PM and 11:59PM, add 12 to the hour.
If you want a time during the midnight hour (12:00AM to 12:59AM), the hour is represented as "00".
Otherwise, morning hours do not require the leading zero.

Task.nme: Email Control: Setup: Input: End Time

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%input Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Select the time of day you want to stop receiving notifications for new emails.
### NOTE ### The time must be in 24 hour format.
If you want a time between 1:00PM and 11:59PM, add 12 to the hour.
If you want a time during the midnight hour (12:00AM to 12:59AM), the hour is represented as "00".
Otherwise, morning hours do not require the leading zero.
